bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, January 5, 1903

div1.p: Carroll asks to borrow a journal from Howard that is not in the library. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, January 5, 1903
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
[unclear]
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE.
Office of the Chief, Letters Received
Three Centimeters
Over
✓
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
ARMY MEDICAL SCHOOL,
WASHINGTON.
Jan'y 5, 1903
Dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
If you
have a copy of the report
of Ribas and Lutz will you
kindly loan it to me for con-
sultation? The journal which
contains it is not supplied to
the library. I am very anxious
to cite his results to next Saturday
in Philadelphia.
